meanings.definition: To lend more than the value of collateral.
meanings.sent1: She decided to overlend her friend some money, even though she knew it was risky.
meanings.sent2: The bank had to deal with the consequences of overlending to customers who couldn't repay.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel overlend acorns to its neighbor, hoping to make a new friend.
meanings.sent4: His generosity knew no bounds as he continued to overlend his possessions to those in need.
meanings.sent5: The teacher warned the students not to overlend their textbooks, as they might not get them back.

meanings.sent1: The shopkeeper would often overlend goods to customers who couldn't afford them.
meanings.sent2: It's important for financial institutions not to overlend to avoid economic instability.
meanings.sent3: The magician overlend his tricks, leaving the audience in awe of his skills.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness led her to overlend her time and energy to various charitable causes.
meanings.sent5: The chef would overlend ingredients to his colleagues, ensuring everyone could cook delicious meals.

meanings.sent1: He would often overlend money to his friends, putting his own financial stability at risk.
meanings.sent2: Overlending can lead to financial troubles if not done responsibly.
meanings.sent3: The superhero overlend his powers to defeat the villain, knowing it was a risky move.
meanings.sent4: Despite warnings, she continued to overlend her resources, hoping to help as many people as possible.
meanings.sent5: The explorer overlend his supplies to the team, determined to reach the summit of the mountain.
